intro: Antidesma leptocladum var. genuinum, commonly known as the slender-leaf antidesma, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes plants known for their diverse morphological features. The plant typically has small, elliptical leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. Its flowers are unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants, a characteristic known as dioecy. The fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
